credentials: PHD 1984 University of Texas at Austin
name: JOSEPH SALMONS

ratings.comment: Prof. Salmons was a great professor and clearly wanted the students to benefit from his class! He was very accommodating and made sure to check in on us many times throughout the semester. A lot of the class was discussion based, and he seemed to value what all of the students had to say. Definitely would recommend!

Joe has big Dad energy. There is no other way to explain his persona. There are a lot of readings in this course, and they are not always easy to understand, but his lectures are amazing and really explain everything. He really cares about his students, and is pretty lenient when it comes to deadlines, just as long as you do the homework.

Joe is an absolute beast. I loved this class. Although I was completely green to linguistics coming in, I did not feel left behind at all. He presents the information in a way that is robust but also easily accessible. This is a Comm B course, so be ready to write. I would highly recommend this course for those looking for an interesting Comm B.

Joe is fantastic. This class was a mix of people who have no linguistic experience and grad students in Linguistics, so the content is suited for everyone. There's a bit of memorization in the first half of the course, but after the ONE exam, it's mainly focussed on a final project. Joe was cheery and always encouraged a fun discussion.

Joe was an awesome teacher, and really willing to help students do well in classes. He also is more than willing to help students pursue goals outside of classes. All around a great person, and always answers questions quickly and thoroughly. 10 out of 10 would highly recommend.

Joe is an awesome guy and teacher. I really liked the class and despite not knowing anything about linguistics coming in, I was able to understand the content and learn something. Most of the semester revolves around your own research project so pick one and stick with it. He is a very cool guy about I would recommend his classes

Ling303 (Or 700 level German Sound Change) was a discussion/reading based class. It culminates in a big research project that can be done in a group. Prof Salmons is so knowledgable and loves sharing things he knows. Lecture is fun and he is very engaging. One of my favorite profs.

Joe is a really great guy. The entire course is surrounded by a research project of your choice and he helps guide you in the right direction. Overall a super easy course, and actually kind of interesting considering it is about linguistic. He grades more than fairly and I would definitely take it again.

Joe is a super good professor. For Language and Immigration in Wisconsin, the whole semester is basically designed to build up into a research paper. Joe is very helpful throughout the whole class and gives good lectures that are interesting. He also brought us chocolate back from Switzerland one day. Would highly recommend his class.

I loved this class! I had no previous knowledge of linguistics or language in WI and was totally fine. As long as you are interested in the topic you are writing about you will get a good grade. Lectures are interesting and engaging. Professor Salmons is hilarious and passionate about the class. If you need a Comm B this is the one to take!!

I really loved this class and learned a lot from it. Final paper was very manageable since it was balanced during the semester. He gives you more than enough feedback for you to really nail it. If you are interested in dialects I would really recommend this class, even if you aren't it's a nice contrast and the workload is great for a fun class.

Joe was easily the nicest professor I have had. He knows what he's talking about and is very passionate. He was really helpful with all the papers we wrote and gave thorough feedback on all the papers. He was lenient with deadlines so that you could write a better paper rather than a bad, rushed one. Definitely recommend the class to everyone
